meaningMnemonic:
The noun version of <kanji>cloudy</kanji> is <vocabulary>cloudy weather</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>cloudiness</vocabulary>. In some cases, this can also refer to the type of <vocabulary>fog</vocabulary> you'd find on a window or your glasses.

Despite being a noun in Japanese, you'll actually see this translated as the adjective "cloudy" in English a lot. Don't let that fool you, though, it still behaves as a noun in Japanese! It's just another example of word types not quite matching up between English and Japanese.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji.
